Team lead HR with high growth experience (m/w/d) // fotograf.de

Company: fotograf.de

Tags:

fotograf.de/GotPhoto is the market-leading workflow and sales solution for professional photographers in Europe and has a strong footprint in the US market.

We’re on a mission to make photographers more successful in their business. We achieve this by moving photography businesses which, in Europe and North America, photograph more than 120 million children every year from the analogue to the digital world.

Our business model creates a real win-win situation for all parties involved: By using fotograf.de, photographers save 50% of their admin-effort that they can then invest in winning new clients and photo jobs. fotograf.de benefits from more orders handled by our platform. In 2018, we processed 1 million orders and we’re growing fast.

Since we’re profitable as a business, we can focus on building sustainable solutions. We are a strong team of over 50 people that supports each other in a family-like environment and has an amazing time working towards a common purpose. We will speak the truth, acknowledge mistakes, share advice, help each other and celebrate successes.

Your mission

We are already beyond the early start-up stage with around 50 employees and plan to scale our headcount to 75 in the next year.

You’ll be leading our small HR team (1 full-time remote, 1 working student) with the purpose of

  • Help us grow and scale our hiring process by recruiting excellent talent
  • Developing and implementing a great employee experience which shows how much we value each member of our team and keeps our turnover rate low

Markus – as CEO and your direct report – decides about the strategic direction of the overall HR department. You translate it into an operational level & prioritize everything as necessary.

Your role

  • Together with your team, you execute the HR strategy into daily business: You are responsible for e.g. developing a leadership hiring strategy, but also take over your share of doing interviews with the respective candidates

Candidate experience

  • You are responsible for introducing best practices and improve processes
  • You recruit our new team members in accordance with the role definition of the hiring manager and within the scope of the right selection criteria
  • Employer Branding: You ensure that the right candidate pool understands our USP as Employer

Employee experience

  • You are responsible for maintaining and improving the overall HR life cycle from onboarding to contract management, payroll, leave management and offboarding
  • You ensure that our core values are translated & lived by our employees
  • You mediate between different stakeholders to build and maintain trust between them, in a personal but professional way: your door is always open

Skills we are looking for

  • Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in recruiting and employee development in an international, high-growth company
  • First leadership experience
  • You have a natural ability to connect and interact with people paired with a high level of professionalism and discretion
  • You are well structured, organized and persistently work for your goals
  • You have excellent communication skills in German and English

We offer

  • Meaningful work in a profitable and growing company with many opportunities for career progression and a strong team spirit and integrity
  • Flexible working hours (e.g. regular home office) and a competitive salary
  • Regular training and coaching, external/internal training and a budget for books and courses of a minimum of 300€
  • Yearly paid team holidays (Feb 2019: 4 days in Lanzarote)

And much more…

  • Your own personal On-boarding Buddy who will help you integrate into our workplace family faster
  • Regular get-togethers, such as monthly team brunches, team events, Brownbag Sessions
  • Spendit-card with monthly lunch money (after successfully passing the trial period)
  • You’ll get your own laptop and all other tools required

That is the challenge, you’re looking for?

We are looking forward to your application! Your personal recruiter is Ana Walka

More information on why to work with us, our team and journey as a company: https://www.fotograf.de/jobs

items.content:
Talent Acquisition Specialist at

Remote

Contract to Hire

Location: Remote

Job Information

Start up company looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist (TAS)/Recruiter responsible for acquiring the most qualified employees to meet the staffing needs for Government and Private sector. Develops new strategies and programs to attract both qualified internal and external candidates to open positions and ensures a constant pipeline of qualified candidates are available for interviewing. This position works closely with management team on determining best recruiting strategies, forecasting staffing needs, customizing skill and testing requirements and implementing high quality interviewing selection techniques. This position will also assist with various other Human Resources duties as needed.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with hiring managers and other team members to create a partnership that yields success, predictable results, and credibility.
  • Learn and understand each position responsible for filling.
  • Develop and maintain a network of contacts to help identify and source qualified candidates.
  • Build applicant sources by researching and contacting community services, colleges, employment agencies, and internet sites; providing organization information, opportunities, and benefits; making presentations; maintaining rapport.
  • Build and maintain the candidate pool; keeping in touch with applicants to build interest in Percepta for future openings.
  • Post, update and ensure consistency of all internal and external job postings.
  • Leads candidate selection activities including screening, assessment process and interviewing.
  • Review resumes and credentials for appropriateness of skills, experience, and knowledge in relation to position requirements.
  • Provide complete, accurate, and inspiring information to candidates about the company and position.
  • Prescreen candidates and present to hiring managers for interview.
  • Coordinate all communication with candidates.
  • Help with scheduling and logistics of all interviews between candidates and hiring managers.
  • Works closely with hiring managers and peer Talent Acquisition Specialists to ensure a satisfactory interview process, leaving candidates with a great experience.
  • Stay abreast of current legislation and policy changes to ensure recruiting activities follow all processes and procedures outlined by Percepta policies and Federal, State, and Local employment law.
  • Facilitate post-offer process with employees once offer has been accepted.
  • Conduct on-boarding and orientation with new hires.
  • Administrative duties as needed.

Education

  • High School Diploma or higher

Experience

  • 1-5 years of progressive recruitment experience in a high volume recruitment environment (agency recruiting experience a plus).
  • Knowledge of sourcing techniques using social media and experience using LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook to identify and engage talent.
  • Strong (and current) knowledge of all laws and regulations pertaining to employment and equal opportunity.
  • HR Information System experience.
  • College recruiting experience desirable.
  • Strong organizational, time management, planning and problem solving skills.
  • A strong sense of urgency and the ability to work in an environment with time sensitive deadlines.

Skills

  • Must possess strong Internet, active, and passive candidate search skills
  • Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to manage multiple assignments and excel in a high volume demanding environment
  • Proficiency in HRIS and Applicant Tracking Systems required
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Applications (Word, Excel, Power Point) required
  • Understands the external marketplace and the impact it has on sourcing strategies (i.e. competition, unemployment rate, movement of companies in/out of area)
  • Ability to develop strong relationships with all levels of management and external resources
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and applicants

Are you passionate about romance fiction? Do you want to earn a consistent income?

Job Overview

We are currently looking to expand our fiction team with amazing and experienced romance writers in all romance subgenres. Please note, writers must be US/Canada-based romance writers, but exceptions can be made if you are a brilliant writer from another native English country.

We are a fast-paced, growing ghostwriting service that can provide you with consistent and exciting projects! We offer continuous work without having to apply for each job. The work comes to you. Regardless of your romance subgenre preferences, we may have a job for you.

If you are someone who takes pride in your work and you’re looking to earn a consistent income doing something you enjoy while working from the comfort of your home or office alongside an exciting and brilliant team, then you may just fit our criteria and land yourself an exciting new gig.

The Company

Our brand is synonymous with high quality writing and a great customer experience. Our online reviews are a testament to our values. We are thrilled and continue to strive for more.

However, our focus isn't just on our clients, but also on the team that helps make this happen. We love our team and are dedicated to creating an enjoyable work environment. Our working relationship ensures we can keep their calendars full of exciting projects while providing them with a steady income.

In return, our writers make sure that every client receives an outstanding experience from start to finish. As a collective, we're always looking for ways to improve our process. Our commitment to quality is an aspect of our brand. We're always looking to improve, which is part of the reason our company has continued to grow.

This growth also extends to our community of writers. We have a number of development programs which allows our team to take their craft to a higher level. These programs include our book club, mastermind groups, editor feedback, and writing discussions, along with other activities. Our development program is run by USA Today best-selling romance author, Delsheree Gladden, who leads our Training and Development department. So you’ll be managed and trained by the best.

Please keep reading if this resonates with you. 

Pay Rate

Our current rate is $15 USD per 1,000 words. Our projects range from 20k to 150k words.

Our busier writers earn $2,000+ a month writing a few hours a day around their studies and  other gigs. 

Our Requirements

We're looking for romance writers with a good basic skill level, who are familiar with similar paced roles. Partnered with a good understanding of romance conventions, as well as the tropes of our preferred romance themes. 

Here's what's required to be part of our team:

  • You write amazing romance stories with a lot of tension, suspense, great dialogue, and good character development and characterization.
  • You are US/Canada based, or an exceptional writer from a different native English country.

Finally, you must fully understand what a ghostwriting position entails; no official credit will be given to you for the work completed.

Now, find out more about your specific role below:

FICTION COPYEDITORS

We’re seeking exceptional fiction copyeditors, especially if you’re experienced with editing romance writing, for a copyediting/line-editing hybrid position.

Our rate is $5 per 1,000 words. Projects range from 20K to 150K words each. So, you can make good money on a single project, and with our workflow, we can keep your pipeline full of exciting projects. Once hired, you are not required to apply for or bid on jobs. Based on your capacity, jobs come to you!

Fiction Copyeditor tasks

Here’s an overview when editing books with our company:

  • Ensuring characteristics of people, plot, objects, and the timeline are consistent. 
  • Removing overused words.
  • Tightening the language used. Ensure it’s clear and fluid.
  • Tightening transitions and scenes. Ensuring it all makes sense and reads well.
  • Improving tone and phrasing.
  • Improving the rhythm and pacing.
  • Lookout for narrative digressions.
  • Tackling errors: grammar, spelling, punctuation, capitalization, syntax, font usage, numerals, hyphenation.
  • Writing craft: paragraph structure and sentence structure.
  • Voice and style.
  • Overall, delivering a piece that is error-free, reads well, is consistent, cohesive, and complete.

You’ll be working one-on-one with writers, interacting with clients, and be a key player in each project!

NONFICTION COPYEDITORS

  • Checking for accuracy and usefulness of information (value offered to the reader).
  • Correcting errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, capitalization, syntax, font usage, numerals, and hyphenation.
  • Rhythm, readability, and pacing.
  • Writing craft: paragraph structure, sentence flow, tense, word choice, and language technique.
  • Voice and style.
  • Editing for consistency.
  • Overall, delivering a piece that is error-free, reads well, is consistent, cohesive, and complete

You’ll be working one-on-one with writers, interacting with clients, and be a key player in each project!

Our brand is synonymous with the highest quality writing and an exceptional customer experience. Our client reviews are a testament to our values. CONTRACT

People at Protocol Labs

The People Team at Protocol Labs powers our work. Protocol Labs is a product-development lab, but behind the protocols and tools we build, behind the research and spec work, behind our implementations are passionate people, teammates and community members. The People Team ensures that the Protocol Labs team remains happy, aligned and productive. Protocol Labs works at the intersection of many exciting fields (crypto, networks, distributed systems) and cultures (startups, research, open source, distributed work). The People Team has the challenging and exciting task of taking the best from these cultures to shape the way we work at PL and ensure we all grow as people and professionals. All of this happens in an environment defined by curiosity, passion, and a love for open source.

As Recruiting Coordinator at Protocol Labs you will…

  • Coordinate, schedule, and manage interviews across multiple time zones, making sure candidate and interviewers are in the right place at the right time with the information they need
  • Provide an amazing candidate experience, ensuring candidates are kept in the loop, receive timely information and are treated with the utmost care throughout their process
  • Use our Applicant Tracking System (Lever), GitHub, Google Suite, Slack and other relevant recruiting tools and processes to keep our busy team organized and on track, while practicing good data hygiene

  • Experience coordinating complex, high volume schedules across multiple time zones, and maintaining related calendar invites
  • Deep flexibility and creativity around adapting to fast-changing needs and priorities

We have a great benefits package, including parental leave, contributions to your retirement, competitive pay, and unlimited time off. For U.S.-based employees, we also provide platinum-level health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family.

International HR Executive (Startup Remote Work for Early Career)

Looking to join a company where you can make an impact? Are you looking for flexibility in your career and craving creative freedom?

This role is perfect for you, if you're looking for opportunities to grow and be part of a growing global team.

Shield GEO provides outsourced employment and payroll in over 90 countries. You will be supporting our team of global mobility consultants in the ongoing management of our GEO employees based all over the world. Your role is to help them in delivering great customer service.

This is an administration heavy role. You will have plenty of support from our operational teams, systems and technology platform.

You will have the opportunity to work remotely and with flexible hours. We are happy to support you if you’d like to travel while working with us, but expect you to have completed your training before commencing your travel plans. You’ll also have the opportunity to advance your career in a young, growing company.

Your background

  • A degree in HR, International Business, Finance or Law is preferred
  • You will need to be a recent university graduate to be considered for this role
Working with Shield

If the thought of being part of a young company with opportunities to create and ideate excite you, you’re at the right place. This is a chance for you to get into the International HR and Global Mobility industry.

We’re a remote-friendly company with employees all around the world. We don’t want to be limited by location and are open to hiring anyone from anywhere – as long as it’s a great fit for us both.

Every person is unique. At Shield GEO, we encourage an inclusive culture that embraces each individual’s differences. We believe that diversity of thought is vital to generating creative ideas, developing effective strategies and making better decisions.

When hiring we do not discriminate by any unlawful means including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

We offer reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities wherever possible. Our employees are provided with the basic equipment required to give them a comfortable, safe and productive workplace. If you require additional equipment beyond our standard offering we are happy to work with you to try to find a solution.

Before we get to know you, you might like to get an idea of who we are so you can decide if you want to be a part of what we’re about.

We can’t quite show you what it’s like to work with us but you can hear from our employees themselves. Here’re some articles written by our Co-Founder,Customer Success Manager and Digital Marketing Manager.

  • Working remotely and flexibly with Shield Geo
  • Leave policy
  • Work equipment policy
  • Workplace Diversity policy

Do you fit our culture?

We think these are the most important characteristics for all Shield GEO employees. Is this you?

  • You love to get things done and you especially like solving problems.
  • You have empathy with your customers and partners
  • You are well organized with an eye for detail. Please keep your cover letter under 250 words and highlight one achievement you're most proud of.
  • You’re self-motivated. You’ll be reporting to someone in another time-zone and be comfortable being judged on your results.
  • You are clear, detailed and thoughtful in expressing yourself whether you’re on the phone, sending an email or making notes on a case. We are a mostly remote company interacting with a broad range of people located all over the world. Clear and detailed communication is essential in this environment. When dealing with external parties, you will need to ask questions and provide answers in ways that anyone can understand. Your written notes in our internal systems must make your work and decisions easy for others to follow.
  • You use analytical skills to understand the root cause of a problem.
  • You are decisive but also open to feedback if something isn’t working.
  • You are persistent. If you run into a roadblock you will try another approach.
  • You keep an eye on the big picture so you can identify longer term improvements to processes and systems. You try to get a little better every day and understand the long term benefits gained by creating reliable processes and systems.
  • You love helping people and pride yourself on your interaction with customers / business units.
Essential Characteristics of this role

  • You are very well organised and resourceful, including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills while coordinating with an international team
  • You are extremely self-disciplined and able to prioritise your work efficiently
  • Takes initiative, outcome focused
Responsibilities

You will be working very closely with an account manager as part of the global mobility team, this requires you to be in EU/East Coast USA time zones. Most of us work remotely and communicate via video communication tools. You should therefore also have excellent internet communication.

CASES

  • Create cases
  • Update our CRM platforms with latest status on cases
  • Monitor progress of cases raised by account managers (AMs) and alert/request action from Subject Matter Experts if a case has been left unattended for too long
INVOICING

  • Send input requests from AM account
  • Update our communication platforms with client responses and add inputs to the checklist as per AM's instructions
  • Compile AM emails for clients who do respond to inputs by deadline to inform them we are proceeding with no additional inputs
  • Send invoices from AM account
  • Create out of cycle (OOC) invoices as per AM instructions
  • Compile emails for AM to request for unpaid invoices
  • Update invoice status page
  • Ensure checklists are updated
Invoice Creation – Verification

  • Support Account Manager in inputting monthly invoicing figures in Salesforce for the required clients
  • Check the relevant invoicing card checklist item has been updated
  • Ensure the expense reports are saved with the right naming convention and in the relevant folder created on Salesforce
Sending Invoices

  • Support the Account Manager in sending out all payroll and OOC invoices
  • Ensure Salesforce invoice card is updated with the actions completed
  • Prepare follow up email templates for the AMs to send to clients
PAYSLIPS

  • Send payslips to employees who've requested a PDF copy
  • Update checklists with progress of process diligently
  • Inform the client and the employees on a monthly basis when payslips have been uploaded into Salesforce Dropbox
RENEWALS FOR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS (EC) AND WORK PERMITS (WP)

  • Create EC/WP expiry emails to client on behalf of your AM, and update our CRM platform accordingly
  • Create case for tracking purposes
  • Request local partners to proceed with renewal

We’re a Data-Driven fast growing global e-commerce company. We create and expand brands worldwide, laser focused in performance marketing and online direct response strategies. For us it is key to excel in everything that we do, and this starts with the people that we hire.

We have an international team hand selected from 4 continents and we are looking for a strong, hands-on leader to join us as Growth hacker to help us keep on changing people’s lives while growing the company exponentially.

The ideal candidate possesses the following qualities:

At Close, we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we’re leading the industry toward eliminating manual processes and helping companies to close more deals (faster).

We’re hiring our first in-house Recruiter to take Close talent management efforts to the next level while serving the incredible team we already have! (80% Recruiting / 20% Retention). As an ambassador of Close, you’ll be representing our team, culture, and brand. You should have a commitment to integrity, friendly-strength, and team building.

You have a proven track record of successfully recruiting for a remote, SaaS or tech company. You’re someone that showcases a high level of discernment, exceptional attention to detail with strong follow-up and follow-through.

You are comfortable working remotely as part of a small team, with a high level of autonomy. You can devise your own schedule and effectively manage your workload based on the biggest opportunities and company objectives.

As Close’s Recruiter you will be the main point of contact for all candidates and team members involved in recruiting and therefore anticipating needs on both sides is a critical part of this role. You’ll report directly to the Director of People Ops, Mary Hartberg and work closely with all hiring Managers at Close.

Attracting top talent for Close is a recruiter’s dream. Our most recent team insights survey rated satisfaction of working at Close 9 out of 10 Our organization is committed to providing a healthy and diverse work environment – read more in our Guide To Us and Glassdoor reviews.

  • Proficiency with an ATS (Greenhouse or Lever preferred)
  • Exceptional written and spoken English
  • Successful experience sourcing candidates, running outbound campaigns and using matching sites

Why Close?

At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our organization – we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).

We come from 13 countries and 16 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community.

This team is growing in more ways than one – we’ve recently launched 10 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers.

    • Hi! We are Day Job, two former friends and current business partners who together make up possibly the most atypical tech headhunting shop the world has ever seen.

    We’re growing, and we’re looking for someone who wants something more (autonomy, variety, freedom), and something less (meetings, reporting, workplace theatre). On the outside, you’re a full-cycle recruiter with 2-3 years of experience, confident in your sourcing and client management skills. You’ll be the main point of contact for clients and be responsible for sourcing and building your own pipeline of candidates for a few roles at a time, from screening to submission. On the inside, you’re conscientious, pragmatic, motivated, and structured, and feel excited about collaborating with a small group but also working efficiently on your own and taking back some of your life from the traditional 40-hour work week.

    You should have experience with and opinions about recruiting processes, quality of feedback, and interviewing best practices. You should feel comfortable sourcing for the typical roles in design, product management, and engineering found in internet tech companies.

    If you’re interested please send over a CV and if you want, a quick 1-minute audio message about yourself to [email protected] and we’ll get back to you.

    About us:

    While it was always our dream to start our own boutique search firm, we deferred… honing our chops at places like SoundCloud, Square, Pinterest, and Amazon. Despite the fancy pedigree, we’ve always approached recruitment a bit differently. We talk to people like they’re people, keep things simple, connect quality with quality, and generally just live the dolce vita. As a small company, we’ve built our reputation and business on our networks and word of mouth. We don’t do marketing and aren’t looking to take over the world. We’re selective about our clients, only working with those who we feel are good people and make or offer interesting and healthy products and services.  We have core weekly working hours where we’re together in our office in Moabit. The rest is when and where you want. We’re also flexible on comp, from a traditional fixed salary to a commission-based plan, or a combination of the two depending on your risk-reward profile. We have generous vacation allowances and creative remote working opportunities. We’re flattered if you want to move across the world to work for Day Job, however, we can’t support a visa or relocation.
